verses.text: 耶和華忿怒的杖我是在耶和華忿怒的杖下受過苦的人。

words.note: Often represents authority or judgment in biblical texts.
Often represents authority or judgment in biblical texts.
Used as a locative suffix after a noun.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '受過苦' (one who has suffered).

verses.text: 他領我，使我行在黑暗中，不行在光明裡。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix after a noun.
Used as a locative suffix after a noun.

verses.text: 他真是終日不停地反手攻擊我。

words.note: Used here for emphasis: 'truly is'.
Connects an adjective/verb to modify a following verb.
Idiomatic in biblical context for persistent opposition or striking.

verses.text: 他使我的肌膚衰殘，折斷我的骨頭。

words.note: Refers to the physical body.

verses.text: 他築壘圍困我，使毒害和艱難環繞我。

words.note: Refers to building defenses or siege engines.

verses.text: 他使我住在黑暗之處，好像死了許久的人一樣。

words.note: Often used metaphorically in biblical contexts.
A more formal or literary way to say 'place'.
Indicates completed action or change of state.

verses.text: 他築牆圍住我，使我不能逃出去；他又加重我的鋼鍊。

words.note: More formal than `鐵鍊 (tiěliàn)` for iron chain.

verses.text: 甚至我哀求呼救的時候，他也掩耳不聽我的禱告。

words.note: Often used idiomatically to describe intentional ignorance.
Primarily used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 他用砍鑿好的石頭堵塞我的道路，他使我的路徑曲折。

words.note: Refers to shaping stone or wood with tools.
Here acting as a resultative complement, meaning 'done well' or 'ready'.
Can refer to physical paths or metaphorical difficulties.

verses.text: 他像熊埋伏著，又像獅子在藏匿的地方，等候攻擊我。

words.note: Indicates a continuous state or action.
More formal than `躲藏 (duǒcáng)`.
Slightly more formal or patient than just `等 (děng)`.

verses.text: 他把我拖離大路，把我撕碎，棄我於荒野。

words.note: Marks the direct object before the verb in a 'bǎ' construction.
Classical Chinese preposition, similar to '在' or '到'.
Often refers to uncultivated, wild areas in biblical context.

verses.text: 他拉開了他的弓，立我作箭靶子。

words.note: Lit. 'arrow target'; an object to be shot at.

verses.text: 他把他箭囊中的箭，射進我的肺腑。

words.note: Refers to one's innermost feelings or vital organs, often symbolizing the core of a person.

verses.text: 我成了眾民譏笑的對象，他們終日以我為歌嘲諷我（全句或譯：「我成了眾民的笑柄，他們終日唱頌的諷歌。」）。

words.note: Often used in classical or formal contexts, e.g., '以...為...'.
Used in the '以...為...' construction meaning 'to take ... as ...'.
Lit. 'laughing handle'; a person made an object of ridicule.
In biblical context, '頌' often refers to hymns or praises.

verses.text: 他使我飽嘗苦菜，飽享苦堇。

words.definition: fully experience, taste to the full
words.note: Suggests experiencing something completely, often suffering or hardship.
Refers to bitter herbs, often symbolic of hardship or slavery in the Bible.
Used here to indicate a full measure of suffering, not enjoyment.
In biblical context, '堇' often refers to wormwood or gall, symbolizing bitterness and suffering.

verses.text: 他用沙石使我的牙齒破碎，把我踐踏在灰塵中。

words.note: Often used after a noun to indicate 'in/among'

verses.text: 你使我失去了平安，我已忘記了福樂是甚麼。

words.note: Refers to a state of calm and well-being.
Often refers to spiritual joy or blessedness.

verses.text: 所以我說：「我的力量已消失了，我從耶和華所得的盼望也沒有了。」

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Often used with 得 to form a noun phrase of 'that which is obtained'.

verses.text: 哀求憐憫回憶起我的困苦飄流，就像是苦堇和毒草。

words.note: Here functions as part of a compound meaning 'imploring mercy'.
A key concept in biblical theology.
Indicates the beginning of an action or recalling something.
A plant known for its bitter taste, often symbolic of bitterness or sorrow in the Bible.

verses.text: 每逢我的心想起往事，我的心就消沉。
但我的心一想起下面這件事，我就有指望。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual hope or expectation.

verses.text: 耶和華的慈愛永不斷絕，他的憐憫永不止息。

words.note: Refers to God's covenant love and loyalty (Heb. chesed).

words.definition: to cease, to be cut off

words.note: Often used for divine pity and compassion.

verses.text: 每天早晨都是新的；你的信實多麼廣大！

words.note: Refers to God's unwavering faithfulness and trustworthiness.

verses.text: 我心裡說：「耶和華是我的業分，所以，我必仰望他。」

words.note: Refers to God as the believer's designated inheritance.

words.definition: to look up to, to hope in
words.note: Implies reliance and expectation, especially towards God.

verses.text: 仰望救恩耶和華善待等候他的和心裡尋求他的人。

words.definition: to look up to, to hope in
words.note: Implies reliance and expectation, especially towards God.
Refers to spiritual salvation from sin and death.

words.definition: to treat kindly, to be good to

words.note: Here, it turns the preceding phrase into a nominalized group ('those who wait for him').
Here, it turns the preceding phrase into a nominalized group ('those who seek him').

verses.text: 安靜等候耶和華的救恩，是多麼的美好！
人在幼年時就負軛，是多麼的美好！

words.note: A literary term, common in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 他要無言獨坐，因為這是耶和華加在他身上的。
他要把自己的口埋於塵土中，或者還有盼望。

words.note: Often used in biblical or literary contexts.
Common in general but very prominent in religious contexts.

verses.text: 他要讓人打他的臉頰，要飽受凌辱。

words.note: A formal term for severe insult or humiliation.

verses.text: 主必不會永遠丟棄人。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ.

verses.text: 他雖然使人憂愁，卻必照著他豐盛的慈愛施憐憫。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to describe God's grace or blessings.
A key concept for God's steadfast love in the Bible.
Frequently used for divine mercy in religious texts.

verses.text: 因為他心裡本不是要人受困苦，或是要世人愁苦。

words.note: Commonly refers to affliction and suffering in biblical texts.
Often used in biblical contexts to distinguish humanity from God.
A frequent theme of human suffering in scripture.

verses.text: 人把地上所有被囚的，都踐踏在腳下，

words.note: Describes those held captive or in prison, often literally or spiritually in the Bible.
Turns '被囚' (imprisoned) into 'those who are imprisoned'.

verses.text: 或在至高者面前，屈枉正直，

words.note: A common divine title for God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 或在訴訟的事上顛倒是非，主不都看見嗎？

words.note: Forms '在...事上' meaning 'in matters of...'
是非 (shìfēi) together means 'right and wrong'.
Refers to God.

verses.text: 除非主命定，誰能說成，就成了呢？

words.note: Refers to God.
說成 (shuōchéng) means 'to speak into being' or 'to bring about by speaking'.

verses.text: 或禍或福，不都是出於至高者的口嗎？

words.note: Refers to God.

verses.text: 人活在世上，因自己的罪受懲罰，為甚麼發怨言呢？

words.note: 發怨言 (fā yuànyán) means 'to complain' or 'to grumble'.

verses.text: 悔改歸向耶和華我們要檢討和省察自己的行為，然後歸向耶和華。
我們要向天上的 神，誠心舉手禱告：

words.note: Indicates obligation or strong desire.
Refers to the divine realm.
Capitalized when referring to the God of the Bible.
A common verb-object compound in religious contexts.

verses.text: 「我們犯罪悖逆，你並不赦免。

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts.
Often found in ancient texts or religious contexts.
Used here to emphasize the negation that follows.
Primarily used in legal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 你被怒氣籠罩著，你追趕我們，殺戮我們，毫不顧惜。

words.note: A more formal and intense term for killing, often in mass or violent contexts.
Emphasizes a complete lack of something.
To show mercy or consideration; common in older or religious texts.

verses.text: 你用密雲把自己遮蔽起來，以致我們的禱告不能達到你那裡。

words.note: Often symbolizes divine presence or concealment in the Bible.
A common directional/aspect complement.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Refers to the location or presence of 'you'.

verses.text: 你使我們在萬族中，成了渣滓和廢物。

words.note: Common phrase in the Bible referring to humanity or ethnic groups.
Used here as a locative suffix.
Often used metaphorically for worthless things or people.
Used metaphorically to describe someone or something worthless.

verses.text: 我們所有的仇敵，都張開口攻擊我們。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual or covenant enemies in biblical texts.

verses.text: 我們遭遇的，只是恐懼、陷阱、毀壞和滅亡。」

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause: 'that which we encountered'.
Often used for national or spiritual ruin in religious contexts.

verses.text: 我的眼淚像江河流下，都因我的人民的滅亡。

words.note: Often used for national or spiritual ruin in religious contexts.

verses.text: 我的眼淚湧流不停，總不止息，

words.note: Often used in literary or religious contexts for ceasing activity or finding rest.

verses.text: 直到耶和華垂顧，從天上關注。

words.note: Implies a higher being paying attention to a lower one, often God's care.

verses.text: 因眼見我城中眾民的遭遇，我的心很痛苦。

words.note: Refers to the general populace, often in a formal or historical context.

verses.text: 那些無故與我為敵的人追捕我，像追捕雀鳥一樣。
他們把我投在坑中要結束我的性命，又把石頭拋在我身上；

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
Refers to life, often in the context of survival or death.
Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.

verses.text: 水淹過我的頭，我說：「我要死了！」
求 神施行拯救耶和華啊，我從坑的最深處呼求你的名，

words.note: Used as a proper noun for God in this context.
A key theological term for salvation/rescue.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 你曾經垂聽我的聲音，現在求你不要掩耳不聽我求救的呼聲。

words.note: Implies God's gracious listening.
Often used figuratively to mean ignore.

words.definition: ask for help, cry for help

verses.text: 我每逢呼求你的時候，你就靠近我，說：「不要懼怕！」

words.note: Common in biblical exhortations.

verses.text: 主啊！你為我的案件申辯，贖回了我的性命。
耶和華啊，你看見了我的冤屈，求你為我主持公道。
你已看見了他們種種的仇恨，以及所有害我的陰謀。
耶和華啊！你已聽見了他們的辱罵，以及所有害我的計謀；
你也聽見了那些起來攻擊我的人嘴裡的話，以及他們終日要攻擊我的企圖。

words.note: Often means 'all day long' in a continuous sense.

verses.text: 你看，他們或坐下或起來，我都成了他們歌唱嘲笑的對象。
耶和華啊！求你按著他們手所作的，報應他們！

words.note: Often carries a sense of divine retribution or consequence.

verses.text: 求你使他們的心頑梗，願你的咒詛臨到他們。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for something befalling someone.

verses.text: 求你在烈怒中追趕他們，從耶和華管治的天下除滅他們。

words.note: Often used in requests or prayers.
Describes intense, violent anger.
Used with '在...中' to indicate 'in the midst of' or 'within'.
Implies actively going after someone or something.
Chinese transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Refers to administrative control or dominion.
Literally 'under heaven', metaphorically refers to the entire world or realm.
Implies complete destruction or wiping out.
